column4: Is there anyway I could show the filesystem types on different partitions?
Having some problems. fsck reports 150k files on my drive, but when I try to mount it... mount can't find the fs on the drive. Any ideas?
What command are you using to mount it and what is the error message?
mount /dev/hdd1 /public .. error: VFS: Can't find ext3 filesystem on dev hdd1
ouch
I just installed ubuntu... it said it never reformatted this drive. I have no idea why it would do this. fsck shows 150k files ... so how does it read those ?
Any ideas?
hm, I'll take that as a no :) Thanks anyways.
Nope, sounds like a broken partition
how could fsck read the files? is there anyway to have fsck relabel it ext3?
I don't know, sorry.
servers are overloaded
Google has tens of thousands of server spread across the world with a massive amount of bandwidth
we have a couple servers running the main archive and a bunch of volunteer mirrors
try switching to another mirror
ok, where is a mirror list?
what country are you in?
USA, California
wait, it's failing on the security ones?
there are no mirrors for those
otherwise, check out https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Archive
Failing on an apt-get upgrade now
